(data tracks such as GoPro GPS, telemetr: (data tracks such as GoPro GPS, telemetry etc. are not copied over by default because ffmpeg cannot cut them, thus they will cause the media duration to stay the same after cutting video/audio)
A mismatch was detected in at least one: A mismatch was detected in at least one file. You may proceed, but the resulting file might not be playable.
Accurate time but could leave an empty p: Accurate time but could leave an empty portion at the beginning of the video. Equiv to

Advanced view disabled. You will now see: Advanced view disabled. You will now see only the most essential buttons and functions.
Advanced view has been enabled. You will: Advanced view has been enabled. You will now also see non-essential buttons and functions.
All streams have been extracted as separ: All streams have been extracted as separate files
Allow multiple instances of LosslessCut: Allow multiple instances of LosslessCut to run concurrently (experimental)
Always open this dialog when opening mul: Always open this dialog when opening multiple files
Are you sure you want to close the curre: Are you sure you want to close the current file?
Are you sure you want to close the loade: Are you sure you want to close the loaded batch of files?
Are you sure you want to quit?: Are you sure you want to quit?
Ask about importing chapters from opened: Ask about importing chapters from opened file
Ask about what to do when opening a new: Ask about what to do when opening a new file when another file is already already open
Ask for confirmation when closing app or: Ask for confirmation when closing app or file
At least one resulting file name contain: At least one resulting file name contains invalid characters
At least one resulting file name has no: At least one resulting file name has no length
At least one resulting file name is the: At least one resulting file name is the same as the input path
At least one resulting file will have a: At least one resulting file will have a too long path
Auto load timecode from file as an offse: Auto load timecode from file as an offset in the timeline
Auto merge segments to one file after ex: Auto merge segments to one file after export
Auto merge segments to one file after export, but keep segments too
Batch convert files to supported format: Batch convert files to supported format
Capture every single frame as an image: Capture every single frame as an image
Capture exactly one image every nth fram: Capture exactly one image every nth frame
Capture exactly one image every nth seco: Capture exactly one image every nth second
Capture frames that differ the most from: Capture frames that differ the most from the previous frame
Capture the best image every nth second: Capture the best image every nth second
Choose cutting mode: Remove or keep sele: Choose cutting mode: Remove or keep selected segments from video when exporting
Clear batch file list after merge: Clear batch file list after merge
Click to select which tracks to keep whe: Click to select which tracks to keep when exporting:
Click to toggle track inclusion when exp: Click to toggle track inclusion when exporting
Convert current file to supported format: Convert current file to supported format
Copy selected segments times to clipboar: Copy selected segments times to clipboard
Could not open media due to error {{erro: Could not open media due to error {{errorCode}}
Current frame has been set as cover art: Current frame has been set as cover art
Cut at the nearest keyframe (not accurat: Cut at the nearest keyframe (not accurate time.) Equiv to
DaVinci Resolve / Final Cut Pro XML: DaVinci Resolve / Final Cut Pro XML
Defaults to same format as input file. Y: Defaults to same format as input file. You can losslessly change the file format (container) of the file with this option. Not all formats support all codecs. Matroska/MP4/MOV support the most common codecs. Sometimes it's even impossible to export to the same output format as input.
Depending on your specific file/player,: Depending on your specific file/player, you may have to try different options for best results.
Discard or extract unprocessable tracks: Discard or extract unprocessable tracks to separate files?
Divide timeline into a number of equal l: Divide timeline into a number of equal length segments
Divide timeline into a number of segment: Divide timeline into a number of segments with the specified length
Divide timeline into segments with rando: Divide timeline into segments with randomized durations and gaps between segments, in a range specified in seconds with the correct format.
Do all of this automatically after expor: Do all of this automatically after exporting a file?
Do you want to align segment times to th: Do you want to align segment times to the nearest, previous or next keyframe?
Do you want to align the segment start o: Do you want to align the segment start or end timestamps to keyframes?
Do you want to shift the start or end ti: Do you want to shift the start or end timestamp by {{time}}?
Don't cut the file, but instead export a: Don't cut the file, but instead export an unmodified original which has chapters generated from segments
Enable HEVC / H265 hardware decoding (yo: Enable HEVC / H265 hardware decoding (you may need to turn this off if you have problems with HEVC files)
Enable this to allow faster playback of: Enable this to allow faster playback of the resulting file. This may cause processing to take a little longer.
Enables shifting when required by the ta: Enables shifting when required by the target format.
End current segment at current time: End current segment at current time
Enter a decimal number between 0 and 1 (: Enter a decimal number between 0 and 1 (sane values are 0.3 - 0.5)
Enter the max number of seconds between: Enter the max number of seconds between each image (decimal)
Enter the number of frames between each: Enter the number of frames between each image (integer)
Enter the number of seconds between each: Enter the number of seconds between each image (decimal)
Export each track as individual files: Export each track as individual files
Export options are not shown. You can en: Export options are not shown. You can enable export options by clicking the icon right next to the export button.
Export options will be shown before expo: Export options will be shown before exporting.
Export options will not be shown before: Export options will not be shown before exporting.
Extract frames from segment as image fil: Extract frames from segment as image files
Extract frames of the selected segment a: Extract frames of the selected segment as images
Extract unprocessable tracks to separate: Extract unprocessable tracks to separate files or discard them
Failed to batch convert to supported for: Failed to batch convert to supported format
Failed to convert file. Try a different: Failed to convert file. Try a different conversion.
Failed to find any prev frame: Failed to find any prev frame
Failed to find any prev keyframe: Failed to find any prev keyframe
Fast: Full quality remux (no audio), lik: Fast: Full quality remux (no audio), likely to fail
Fast: Full quality remux, likely to fail: Fast: Full quality remux, likely to fail
Fast: Remux video, encode audio (fails i: Fast: Remux video, encode audio (fails if unsupported video codec)
Fastest: Low playback speed (audio remux: Fastest: Low playback speed (audio remux), likely to fail
FFmpeg capture method might sometimes ca: FFmpeg capture method might sometimes capture more correct colors, but the captured snapshot might be off by one or more frames, relative to the preview.
File compatibility check is not enabled,: File compatibility check is not enabled, so the merge operation might not produce a valid output. Enable "Check compatibility" below to check file compatibility before merging.
File names of extracted video frames: File names of extracted video frames
File not natively supported. Preview may: File not natively supported. Preview may have no audio or low quality. The final export will however be lossless with audio. You may convert it from the menu for a better preview with audio.
For the ipod format, it is recommended t: For the ipod format, it is recommended to activate this option
For the ipod format, it is recommended to deactivate this option
Hover mouse over buttons in the main int: Hover mouse over buttons in the main interface to see which function they have
If nothing helps, you can send an <1>Err: If nothing helps, you can send an <1>Error report</1>
If output does not look right, see the H: If output does not look right, see the Help menu.
If this is checked, all audio/video/subt: If this is checked, all audio/video/subtitle/data tracks will be included. This may not always work for all file types. If not checked, only default streams will be included.
Include all tracks from the new file: Include all tracks from the new file
Include more tracks from other file: Include more tracks from other file
Instead of video apparently starting at: Instead of video apparently starting at 0, you can offset by a specified value. This only applies to the preview inside LosslessCut and does not modify the file in any way. (Useful for viewing/cutting videos according to timecodes).
Invalid start or end value. Must contain: Invalid start or end value. Must contain a number of seconds.
It's generally recommended to set this t: It's generally recommended to set this to one of: {{values}}
Jump to current segment's end time: Jump to current segment's end time
Jump to current segment's start time: Jump to current segment's start time
Key frames will show on the timeline. Yo: Key frames will show on the timeline. You need to zoom in to view them.
Load segments from the new file, but kee: Load segments from the new file, but keep the current media
Loop beginning and end of current segmen: Loop beginning and end of current segment
Lossless rotation might not work with th: Lossless rotation might not work with this file format. You may try changing to MP4.
Make sure you have no overlapping segmen: Make sure you have no overlapping segments.
Manually input current segment's end tim: Manually input current segment's end time
Manually input current segment's start t: Manually input current segment's start time
Minimum change between two frames to be: Minimum change between two frames to be considered a new scene. A value between 0.3 and 0.5 is generally a sane choice.
No segment to split. Please move cursor: No segment to split. Please move cursor over the segment you want to split.
Not all formats support all track types,: Not all formats support all track types, and LosslessCut is unable to properly cut some track types, so you may have to sacrifice some tracks by disabling them in order to get correct result.
Note that also other settings from the n: Note that also other settings from the normal export dialog apply to this merge function. For more information about all options, see the export dialog.
Note that depending on input parameters,: Note that depending on input parameters, up to {{estimatedMaxNumFiles}} files may be produced!
Note: Cutting and including external tra: Note: Cutting and including external tracks at the same time does not yet work. If you want to do both, it must be done as separate operations. See github issue #896.
Note: Keyframe cut is recommended for mo: Note: Keyframe cut is recommended for most common files
One or more rows does not have 3 columns: One or more rows does not have 3 columns
Open the file instead of the current one: Open the file instead of the current one
Output file already exists, refusing to: Output file already exists, refusing to overwrite. You can turn on overwriting in settings.
Output file name template results in dup: Output file name template results in duplicate file names (you are trying to export multiple files with the same name).
Output file name will not be sanitized,: Output file name will not be sanitized, and any special characters will be preserved. This may cause the export to fail and can cause other funny issues. Use at your own risk!
Output file names are not sanitized. Try: Output file names are not sanitized. Try to enable sanitazion or check your segment labels for invalid characters.
Overwrite files when exporting, if a fil: Overwrite files when exporting, if a file with the same name as the output file name exists
Paste or type a YouTube chapters descrip: Paste or type a YouTube chapters description or textual chapter description
Permanently delete the files if trash fa: Permanently delete the files if trash fails
Please confirm that you want to extract: Please confirm that you want to extract all tracks as separate files
Please create an issue at <1>https://git: Please create an issue at <1>https://github.com/mifi/lossless-cut/issues</1> where you describe what you were doing.
Please input a valid duration. Example:: Please input a valid duration. Example: {{example}}
Please input a valid number of segments: Please input a valid number of segments
Please press your desired key combinatio: Please press your desired key combination. Make sure it doesn't conflict with any other binding or system hotkeys.
Please send an email to <1>losslesscut@m: Please send an email to <1>losslesscut@mifi.no</1> where you describe what you were doing.
Please test the output file in your desi: Please test the output file in your desired player/editor before you delete the source file.
Please test the output files in your des: Please test the output files in your desired player/editor before you delete the source files.
Preserve all MOV/MP4 metadata tags (e.g. EXIF, GPS position etc.) from source file? Note that some players have trouble playing back files where all metadata is preserved, like iTunes and other Apple software.
Press confirm to grant LosslessCut acces: Press confirm to grant LosslessCut access to write the project file (due to App Sandbox restrictions).
Seek backward 1% of timeline at current: Seek backward 1% of timeline at current zoom
Seek forward 1% of timeline at current z: Seek forward 1% of timeline at current zoom
Select a different output <1>Format</1>: Select a different output <1>Format</1> (<3>matroska</3> and <5>mp4</5> support most codecs)
Set current frame as cover art: Set current frame as cover art
Set file modification date/time of outpu: Set file modification date/time of output files to:
Set minimum silence duration that will b: Set minimum silence duration that will be converted into a segment.
Set noise tolerance. Can be specified in: Set noise tolerance. Can be specified in dB (in case "dB" is appended to the specified value) or amplitude ratio. Default is -60dB, or 0.001.
Set the minimum detected black duration: Set the minimum detected black duration expressed in seconds. It must be a non-negative floating point number.
Set the threshold for considering a pict: Set the threshold for considering a picture "black".
Set the threshold for considering a pixe: Set the threshold for considering a pixel "black".
Shift all segments on the timeline by th: Shift all segments on the timeline by this amount. Negative values will be shifted back, while positive value will be shifted forward in time.
Shift timestamps so that the first times: Shift timestamps so that the first timestamp is 0 (LosslessCut default).
Shift timestamps to make them non-negati: Shift timestamps to make them non-negative. Also note that this affects only leading negative timestamps, and not non-monotonic negative timestamps.
Show export options screen before export: Show export options screen before exporting
Some extra tracks have been discarded. Y: Some extra tracks have been discarded. You can change this option before merging.
Start current segment at current time: Start current segment at current time
Start time must be before end time: Start time must be before end time
Store project file (.llc) in the working: Store project file (.llc) in the working directory or next to loaded media file
subtitle: subtitle
Subtitle: Subtitle
The audio track is not supported. You ca: The audio track is not supported. You can convert to a supported format from the menu.
The file name template is missing {{ext}: The file name template is missing {{ext}} and will result in a file without the suggested extension. This may result in an unplayable output file.
The last executed ffmpeg commands will s: The last executed ffmpeg commands will show up here after you run operations. You can copy them to clipboard and modify them to your needs before running on your command line.
The media file referenced by the project: The media file referenced by the project file you tried to open does not exist in the same directory as the project file: {{mediaFileName}}
The media you tried to open does not exi: The media you tried to open does not exist
The size of the merged output file ({{ou: The size of the merged output file ({{outputFileTotalSize}}) differs from the total size of source files ({{sourceFilesTotalSize}}) by more than {{maxDiffPercent}}%. This could indicate that there was a problem during the merge.
The video inside segments will be discar: The video inside segments will be discarded, while the video surrounding them will be kept.
The video inside segments will be kept,: The video inside segments will be kept, while the video outside will be discarded.
There is a known issue with cutting iPho: There is a known issue with cutting iPhone HEVC videos. The output file may not work in all players.
There is a known problem with this file: There is a known problem with this file type, and the output might not be playable. You can work around this problem by enabling the "Experimental flag" under Settings.
There is an error in the file name templ: There is an error in the file name template:
These options will let you convert files: These options will let you convert files to a format that is supported by the player. You can try different options and see which works with your file. Note that the conversion is for preview only. When you run an export, the output will still be lossless with full quality.
This allows you to specify custom FFmpeg: This allows you to specify custom FFmpeg and FFprobe binaries to use. Make sure the "ffmpeg" and "ffprobe" executables exist in the same directory, and then select the directory.
This dialog can be used to concatenate f:
This dialog can be used to concatenate files in series, e.g. one after the other:
[file1][file2][file3]
It can NOT be used for merging tracks in parallell (like adding an audio track to a video).
Make sure all files are of the exact same codecs & codec parameters (fps, resolution etc).
This experimental feature will re-encode: This experimental feature will re-encode the part of the video from the cutpoint until the next keyframe in order to attempt to make a 100% accurate cut. Only works on some files. I've had success with some h264 files, and only a few h265 files. See more here: {{url}}
This file does not have a valid duration: This file does not have a valid duration. This may cause issues. You can try to fix the file's duration from the File menu
This file has embedded chapters. Do you: This file has embedded chapters. Do you want to import the chapters as cut-segments?
This is where working files and exported: This is where working files and exported files are stored.
Title: Title
Toggle zoom between 1x and a calculated: Toggle zoom between 1x and a calculated comfortable zoom level
Tried to create too many segments (max {: Tried to create too many segments (max {{maxSegmentsAllowed}}).
Try each of the following before merging: Try each of the following before merging again:
Try one of the following before exportin: Try one of the following before exporting again:
Try to automatically convert to supporte: Try to automatically convert to supported format when opening unsupported file
Unable to change playback rate right now: Unable to change playback rate right now
Unable to move file to trash. Do you wan: Unable to move file to trash. Do you want to permanently delete it?
Unable to playback this file. Try to con: Unable to playback this file. Try to convert to supported format from the menu.
Unable to save your preferences. Try to: Unable to save your preferences. Try to disable any anti-virus.
Unprocessable streams were exported as s: Unprocessable streams were exported as separate files.
Use this for all files until LosslessCut: Use this for all files until LosslessCut is restarted
View and edit segment tags in JSON5 form: View and edit segment tags in JSON5 format:
Warning: Cutting thumbnail tracks is kno: Warning: Cutting thumbnail tracks is known to cause problems. Consider disabling track {{trackNumber}}.
We are on the first frame: We are on the first frame
We are on the first keyframe: We are on the first keyframe
We are on the last frame: We are on the last frame
What do you want to do after exporting a: What do you want to do after exporting a file or when pressing the "delete source file" button?
When merging, do you want to create chap: When merging, do you want to create chapters in the merged file, according to the cut segments? NOTE: This may dramatically increase processing time.
When merging, do you want to preserve me: When merging, do you want to preserve metadata from your original file? NOTE: This may dramatically increase processing time.
When tracks have different lengths, do y: When tracks have different lengths, do you want to make the output file as long as the longest or the shortest track?
When you export, selected segments on th: When you export, selected segments on the timeline will be KEPT - the surrounding areas will be REMOVED.
When you export, selected segments on the timeline will be REMOVED - the surrounding areas will be KEPT
Where do you want to save output files?: Where do you want to save output files?
Where do you want to save output files? Make sure there is enough free space in this folder.
Whether or not to sanitize output file n: Whether or not to sanitize output file names (sanitizing removes special characters)
Will now cut at the exact position, but: Will now cut at the exact position, but may leave an empty portion at the beginning of the file. You may have to set the cutpoint a few frames before the next keyframe to achieve a precise cut.
Will now cut at the nearest keyframe bef: Will now cut at the nearest keyframe before the desired start cutpoint. This is recommended for most files.
With \"keyframe cut\", we will cut at th: With "keyframe cut", we will cut at the nearest keyframe before the desired start cutpoint. This is recommended for most files. With "Normal cut" you may have to manually set the cutpoint a few frames before the next keyframe to achieve a precise cut.
You can customize the file name of the o: You can customize the file name of the output using special variables.
You can customize the file name of the output segments using special variables.
You do not have permission to access thi: You do not have permission to access this file
You have enabled the &quot;invert segmen: You have enabled the "invert segments" mode <1></1> which will cut away selected segments instead of keeping them. But there is no space between any segments, or at least two segments are overlapping. This would not produce any output. Either make room between segments or click the Yinyang <3></3> symbol below to disable this mode. Alternatively you may combine overlapping segments from the menu.
You have no write access to the director: You have no write access to the directory of this file
You have no write access to the directory of this file, please select a custom working dir
You might want to redact any sensitive i: You might want to redact any sensitive information like paths.
You need to open a media file first: You need to open a media file first
You opened a new file. What do you want: You opened a new file. What do you want to do?
